intro: Anoplophytum sprengelianum, commonly known as the Sprengel's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has smooth, succulent leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
